content.description: A climbing move or two gets you to the start of a curving chimney. Pass several chockstones that offer opportunities for gear inside the chimney. Near the top, either climb deeper into the chimney and burrow through to the top, or stay on the outer edge for the more difficult finish to the anchors. Enough protection can be found along the way to keep you going, but you won't be sewing this one up where ever you'd like. It's a good introduction to climbing in chimneys.
content.location: The obvious chimney in the west side of Left Over Bun. Standing on the west side of the rock, where you can see the Sugarloaf school yard below, this feature is easy to find.

content.description:
Easy slab route on and right of the bolt line.

I've read a 5.10a line goes left of the same bolts, but haven't tried it myself yet.

I've also seen this line called Lumpy Rump elsewhere. If anyone has concrete information I'll update it.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a bolted anchor with rap hardware.
content.location: Southwest corner of the rock immediately south of Left Over Bun. Walk off the very mellow back side or rappel.

content.description: Start on a vertical crack on the the right side of a sharp heart-shaped flake. Mantle to a ledge. Ascend a ramp in a left-facing dihedral. Get up the short final headwall by a harder direct line, or an easy wandering one.
content.protection: A few pieces from your trad rack. Bolted anchors of recent vintage at the top, with rap rings.
content.location: A peripheral rock southwest of the Sugar Bun, and south of the Left Over Bun proper. The rock containing Heart of Sharpness has a large jutting overhang at the top of a slabby south face.

content.description:
Start in the left leaning fist crack (harder with small fists) and move left until you hit the offwidth leading straight up.

Head up the wide crack which quickly eases up, then run out the easy 5th class terrain to the bolts. #6s fit best, Though you can get by with a #6 and #5 or even a single #6.
content.protection: BD #3 to #6. Bolts with rappel rings at the top or walk off.
content.location: Left leaning wide crack on the on the south side of Left Over Bun

content.description:
Some optional gear at the start leads to bolts that protect an awkward arching crack. A strange route to be sure.

Start in the left leaning fist crack (harder if you have small fists) until you .limb past the offwidth that shoots straight up, Get some gear, and work around the left and up into the depths of the chimney.

You can utilize the bolts which are outside the chimney but they kinda get in your way, best to just bring a couple pieces to protect the chimney.

The gear is good inside the chimney, the mental crux is probably getting into the chimney, particularly with the bolt being right in your face, but the entry can be protected by a good #3 and maybe a wonky #6.
content.protection:
Bolts with a couple optional wide pieces for the start.

Or if climbing on gear and skipping the awkward bolts, BD Cams, Single #2 to #6.

Bolts with rappel rings at the top or walk off.
content.location: On the West side of the Left Over Bun.
